title: Area Volume: region bound by 2 functions of x part - b

content.description: Let R be the shaded region in the first quadrant enclosed by the y-axis and the graphs of y = 1 - x3 and y = sin(x2), as shown in the figure above.
content.question: A horizontal line, y = k, is drawn through the point where the graphs of y = 1 - x3 and y = sin(x2) intersect. Find k and determine whether this line divides R into two regions of equal area. Show the work that leads to your conclusion.

frqParts.text: A horizontal line, y = k, is drawn through the point where the graphs of y = 1 - x3 and y = sin(x2) intersect. Find k and determine whether this line divides R into two regions of equal area. Show the work that leads to your conclusion.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
